newsitem.title: USA: Whitman aims to keep investment grade credit.
newsitem.headline: Whitman aims to keep investment grade credit.

text.p: Whitman Corp said Monday it expects to maintain its strong capital structure and remain an investment grade credit as part of its plan to spin off two of business units.

"We expect Whitman will continue to have considerable financial flexibility to take advantage of the significant growth opportunities which exist in the beverage industry," Bruce Chelberg, chairman, said in a statement.
Whitman owns Pepsi-Cola General Bottlers, the world's largest independent Pepsi-Cola franchisee.
Whitman said it plans to spin off its Hussmann Corp and Midas International operations to shareholders.
Hussmann is the world's largest supplier of refrigeration systems for the food industry with operations in nine countries. Sales were more than $1.0 billion in 1996.
Midas is the world's largest franchised automotive service operation, with more than 2,500 stores in 17 countries. Worldwide retail sales by Midas dealers were more than $1.3 billion in 1996.
